website_summaries.verdict: Great for a single camper or a couple seeking minimal setup and a mid-range price.
cons: Heavier than some owners would like

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Plenty long for 6’3” camper. Good airflow control. Super easy setup. Stakes look cheap but actually work fine. A few negatives: -Ingress/egress is a little tough for taller people -Gear loft is lame and improperly sewn Several people complained that it won’t fit back into the sack. Make some mental notes when taking the tent out for the first time. If you fold the tent similar to how it came out it’ll go back in the storage sack just fine. I wouldn’t buy this tent at full MSRP because there are better options for $180. Wait for the price to drop to about $100 and then jump on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ozark Daredevil

customer_reviews.title: Sad given I have always loved all the Mountainsmith gear ...
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 starts due to one of the rain fly buckles is broken... Right out of the bag... I was able to Mcguyver it so it worked for my overnighter.. got home and I sent an email to MountainSmith to see if I could get another buckle... crickets.... Waited for a week before submitting the review...... Sad given I have always loved all the Mountainsmith gear I have purchased. Otherwise the tent did it's job. Worked as intended... Too bad the company isn't more responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Runnin4me

customer_reviews.title: Other than that the tent was great, room enough for a fair amount of gear ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a raft guide and as such lived out of this tent all summer. Literally from April to September this tent was my home. It held up extremely well, minus one of my tent poles splitting at the end. The pole broke during set-up and i felt partially to blame. Other than that the tent was great, room enough for a fair amount of gear plus the dog and myself. Great tent would buy again. Note: Customer service is amazing!! Contacted them about buying a replacement pole for the one I had broken. Had a brand new set waiting at my front door within the week. Would absolutely recommend this tent to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J dean

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpacking tent!!!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this tent for a few years now and it's as good as new after maybe 20-30 nights of camping. It's super well ventilated....which might not be idea if super windy....but otherwise we really like it. We've camped in temps down to the teens and in warm environments. The best part about it is how easily it sets up and packs. There's no need to fold it as it stuffs easily in the bag. And the clip on (high quality aluminum) exterior poles are the only way to go for ease of set up after a long day of backpacking! We'd buy this one again in a heartbeat. (If it ever wears out!)
customer_reviews.author: Mom o' 4

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional tent!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down one of the best "budget " tents I've personally came across. I'm very particular about my gear and even the relatively inexpensive pieces of equipment better pass my high standards and this tent has surpassed all my expectations. Without a doubt this isn't something I'd lug around on a trip solo and why would you want to? However split between two people (as it should be) your golden. If you are looking for a very nice budget friendly tent that won't break the bank but still maintain functionality a quality this is the cats meow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: After a week camping I agree with all of the positive reviews. Great tent for the money!! My sole complaint would be that the foyers feel a bit smaller than the equivalent sized Kelty, but they're still more than enough for your pack, shoes, all that. I'm 6'2" and the two person fit me just great. I do not think it would be remotely comfortable for 2 6-footers. :^) The quality is solid. Aluminum poles are well crafted and thought through as is the over all design. Great value for the money and I'd very likely buy another Mountainsmith tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, backpacking and car camping.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tent, we have 2 now. Very easy to set up. Pockets for storing stuff. Great for backpacking. It doesn’t come with a ground cloth. My son uses it monthly camping with the scouts. We are in NC and it is ok for our winter camping, maybe not a long cold trip, but for his cold winter weekend camping, it serves him well. I would say it compares with the REI tent, but this one is cheaper. We love it! Our older of this tent is probably 3 years old and has been used 50+ times, mostly backpacking, and still seems to be in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C

customer_reviews.title: just BUY it :)
customer_reviews.text: great product. I had it on trail in heavy rain (in Caucasus mountains, namely Chaukhi in Georgia) and not a single drop from condensation or the rain itself got inside! every aspect of this product is well thought: lightweight, super easy to set up, doors on both sides, both doors either fully close/open or turn into ventilation mesh door, lot of ventilation, all open doors have bindings to be secured to tent wall nicely, decent space on both sides between cover and a tent. this item would cost 300$ if marketed by some big name brand
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy Up and Easy Down
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this two person tent for general tent camping. I suppose it would perform well as a backpacking tent. There is plenty of room for one person. After a camping trip to the Eastern Sierras, I discovered the tent was able to withstand a steady thirty mile per hour wind with little or no disturbance to the interior or integrity of the tent. The interior remained dry without a drop of moisture during a rain shower. The tent is easy to set-up and to take-down. After a bit of practice, I'm able to completely set-up the tent in less than five minutes. Thus far I have found no flaws in the materials or workmanship. An exactly tent.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barr

customer_reviews.title: Great company
customer_reviews.text: Really like the tent, the dual vestibules were a huge plus. It's reasonably light, easy enough to assemble, and as long as I separate the tent, poles, and rainfly it's very packable for backpacking. I'd be over the moon if the rainfly connected to the footprint without the tent, but you can't have every feature with every tent. Great experience with the company as well - I look at what they offer whenever I'm in the market for gear now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!!
customer_reviews.text: Rain fly leaks around zippers and vent triangles. Would try and return if it wasn't too late
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent for kayak camping and it was perfect. Great ventilation with two doors for hot nights but also stays warm enough on cool nights. We had a night of rain and tent did not leak. The tent is easy to put up and comes with a gear loft which is nice since that is usually an accessory that is purchased separately. My only problem was the gear loft toggles were loose in the loops and the toggles would slip out. My fix was to twist the loops several times then put the toggle thru and that worked.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne mccain

customer_reviews.title: Go to tent, best in class for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this tent for 5 years. It has been to many many festivals and is my go to tent for weekend camping. It has withstood violent storms and I've never gotten wet. I just applied a new water repellent treatment after all this time and it's like new (the condensation was starting to leak through, expected). Easy to set up and can sleep 2 adults, albeit close. Polls are still in great shape, zippers still work smoothly, and I've only had to patch a small tear in the mesh. For the money I cannot recommend this little tank enough. If you are backpacking it may be a bit on the heavy side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good  quality, but heavier, bulkier than expected
customer_reviews.text: I am quite pleased with the quality, especially the rainfly, and I would have given it a 4 or 5 star rating on that. However, I thought the weight was supposed to be less than 5 pounds and it is well over 5 pounds. Every ounce matters when backpacking. Also the folded size was bigger than expected, so nothing saved there either.
customer_reviews.author: Narlothep

customer_reviews.title: great low cost tent, perfect for gettting started
customer_reviews.text: I've had the mountainsmith morrison 2 tent for a few years. Aside from the low cost there are several things I really like about this tent. The user experience is great, because they have paid attention to small details. Simple example is the set up instructions on the tent bag - so they cannot be lost. The tent is not light, but it is well made and comfortable. I have another tent that is lighter and costs much more, but honestly I prefer to bring this trip for hiking or camping because it is so straightforward to use
customer_reviews.author: Eric M

customer_reviews.title: Great starter backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: Pros: fits two with a bit of room to spare, two vents with kickstands, zip up windows, gear pockets, very easy to pitch, solid in the wind. Cons: a touch on the heavy side for backpacking, vestibules are very small, the gear loft doesn't stay up w toggles very well, the claustrophobic feeling if u sit up. ( wall slant ) the newer version has more vertical walls but weighs more...
customer_reviews.author: Adam Barr

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase! Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. I am a novice, but I researched carefully, and this fit my purposes beautifully. And, it kept me totally dry in heavy rain. It has many nice features, and fellow campers were asking what kind of tent it was and where to purchase. Setting up is a breeze, and I really appreciate the two doors and vestibules. I used it for myself alone (not for 2).
customer_reviews.author: Alice R

customer_reviews.title: There is no better value and quality of construction out there besides this ...
customer_reviews.text: There is no better value and quality of construction out there besides this tent. The company's footprint is costly. I use the small tarps that you can buy at any Walmart, home depot etc. Just make sure it does not extend beyond the tent floor.This can be accomplished by folding it where necessary. Good shelter.
customer_reviews.author: alfred amp phyllis salamat

customer_reviews.title: Very small but easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent even tho it is very small 2-person tent. I am a petite person but took up all the space with charger for my cell, backpack, toiletries, lamps and change of cloths. The set up was so easy - took me one third of the time took my friend to put up her tent.
customer_reviews.author: Baba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The tent went out for the first time this past weekend, and as to be expected, we got caught in a huge thunderstorm. Due to the design of this item (large, fully encompassing rain-fly over an open body), the inside remained completely dry, even as sheets of high-speed wind-driven rain were pummeling it. the guy lines were an absolute necessity. As with all "Two Person" tents, the reality for comfortable use is closer to one person and their gear. At 4-ish lbs., this tent isn't for the ounce-counters of the backpacking world, but it is definitely light enough to be packed in over a few miles. The stuff sack that accompanies this item is roomy and compressible.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Capp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Backpacking Tent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent BP tent, especially when used with the footprint. It sets up super easy, and packs away in the included storage sack easily without having to get scientific. My son and I just used this tent over on the Washington coast, and it poured rain one night, all night long. We stayed perfectly dry and comfortable. My only complaint is the rainfly vestibules should be slightly bigger. Our packs and boots barely fit.
customer_reviews.author: Herbie W.

customer_reviews.title: how do I love thee? Very
customer_reviews.text: Oh tent, how do I love thee? Very, Very MUCH! That's how..... I pulled this out of the box and set it up right away in under 4 minutes! My wife and I entered with our sleeping pads and there was plenty of space for us and BOTH of our packs... and more.... If you are an "ultralight" backpacker (and if you bought this tent, you probably are) there should be absolutely no problem keeping your gear inside the tent with you... very light, good looking, quality design and materials. This is my new favorite tent.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Great tent! No need for add ons
customer_reviews.text: I've spent over 60 nights in this tent, and let me just say it has held up nicely.. I purchased it 3 years ago and its still going strong.. I never used a footprint with it, and so far i haven't had any problems with it in rain or shine. I've stayed while it was downpoaring in a storm and not a single leak! I will be buying another one soon!
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Search on line for many tents for myself one person, finally decided on Morrison and so glad I did. Very easy to install and I'm a total newbie to camping. Reason I chose it was because of the half zip open window allowing me to see outside without fully unzipping door. Also was caught in rain storm on first day and tent stayed completely dry. Great tent!
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Actually space for two people
customer_reviews.text: This actually is a real 2 person tent. I purchased this tent to be able to go with the scout group knowing I would be sleeping by myself with gear. However, there is plenty of room inside for two people to sleep and put your gear in the vestibule. I have used it several times now and love the size and light weight. Make sure you open the air vents in the top of the rainfly because it seals up pretty good and you get condensation from your breath.
customer_reviews.author: Zak MacKay

customer_reviews.title: A temporary home
customer_reviews.text: I live full time in a tent off the back of my motorcycle, this tent lasted a couple months then I had to trash it as the screen ripped, and got another one. It’s ok but I have had $30 Walmart tents that lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Don Logue

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for my son and I while backpakcing
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice 2 person tent. It is rectangular instead of wedge shaped which means you can both be head uphill. I like the dual entry. It has pockets in 2 corners, pockets in all 4 would rock. My 11 year old and I fit just fine. 2 adults would fit but it would be cozy. Large backpacks are tough to fit under the rain fly porch.. That could be a touch bigger. Still very nicely made and overall seems like it will last. You will need to upgrade the tent stakes (have yet to buy a tend I didn't -- This isn't a $600 tent so I can upgrade the stakes)
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but a tiny bit heavier than anticipated.
customer_reviews.text: outstanding quality. I have had lots of tents, none this well put together. I would give it 5 stars, but it is bulkier and heavier than advertised by a few ounces. Its a bit much for long hikes, but at least I will have peace of mind my tent wont blow down or leak. Its so well stitched together Im going to keep it even though I wish it was a half pound less...I'll just bring one less can of beans!
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: This tent is worth way more than about 100 dollars
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this tent well priced on Amazon.com, I have used it twice (once in the spring and summer) during a moderate steady rain and stayed dry all night. Even though other tents that costs hundreds more and may be 5 ounces lighter for backpacking, I am sticking with this one as I am sure it will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Tent poles snapped immediately
customer_reviews.text: I seldom am moved to make a negative review. However, upon initially testing out my tent under friendly, backyard conditions, one of the aluminum poles snapped in half. I'm no amateur to setting up tents and followed instructions on the tent bag carefully in setup. I was given the option of a replacement, but opted for a refund and bought a different tent. I simply am not willing to rely on a tent that broke immediately when I am car camping let alone hiking. If you opt to purchase this well-reviewed tent, I urge you to test it out thoroughly first. I always do with any camping gear that I buy. Pictures of the breakage are attached.
customer_reviews.author: Li Bai

customer_reviews.title: Highly Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. It's sooo easy to set up and take down. Fits good in it's bag with enough room to put a small tarp in for the foot print. We've camped in it twice. The second time it rained for two days not stop. Tent never leaked a drop. I highly recommend this tent if you're looking for a quality tent that's small, lite and won't cost you a small fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nor really a 2 person tent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent because I wanted a lightweight, easy to put up tent for my bug-out bag. I think this tent definitely fits the mark. It was super easy for me to put up all by myself. I am tall and heavyset and I thought this tent accommodated me perfectly. However, it would have been extremely uncomfortable for two people. After a weekend trip, some of the mesh on door had a small rip in it. I patched this easily, but found it rather annoying. Overall a good buy. Just don't expect more than one full-grown adult to sleep in it comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a light weight tent!
customer_reviews.text: I did all kinds of research on backpacking tents. I just completed the kalalau hike in kauai HI. Its 11 miles one way. The tent was very easy to set up and break down. The first night we had to set it up in the dark, it went up in minutes. The two doors is great. Its a very spacious tent. Im 5'10" we were able to sleep 2 people and fit 3 back packs at our heads with plenty of room. For the price this is great!
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: good 'nough shelter.
customer_reviews.text: This tent arrived at my house on a Friday afternoon and with an adult beverage in hand, tent removed from bag along with poles it quickly got assembled in a matter of minutes. I'd throw the tent stakes out and get replacements. My 73 in. height fit quite well within along my dog. Zippers easy to close and open. I do however wish that the fly were capable of extending a bit further out from the door but other than that I have no complaints. Had a heavy rainstorm the night after assembling and the inside was dry....no leaks, no wet spots. I did have a footprint under the floor. Its light weight and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is wonderful. The color coded poles are much more useful than I thought they would be. The size is great for one person. I put all my gear under the rain cover and had gobs of room in the tent. Light weight, quality zippers, two entrances... I can't say enough good things about this tent. If you are a motorcycle camper don't hesitate to pick one of these up.
customer_reviews.author: tomgreig

customer_reviews.title: ... has plenty of room in it and is very easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: It has plenty of room in it and is very easy to put up. It has loads of storing areas, at the corners and over head. The doors open up easily and has a fantastic top cover. There is mainly only one thing that I wish it had differently and that is it's weight. Other than that, I'm very satisfied with the Mountainsmith Morrison 2 tent.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent
customer_reviews.text: Have used this tent for 5 different trips and have really enjoyed the portability of it and how easy it is to set up. The only issue we had is we needed to replace the metal spikes that connect the tent to the ground. After 5 uses they started to bend (1 completely broke) and we were unable to use them anymore. We purchased a high-quality replacement set for under $10.
customer_reviews.author: sg4488

customer_reviews.title: Super reliable. Woke up once in a standing puddle ...
customer_reviews.text: For the value you cannot beat this tent. Super reliable. Woke up once in a standing puddle couple inches high and I was completely dry. This is a very well made tent. It is an older model so it is going to be a little heavier than newer competitors but for the price I don't mind the minimal weight increase. Superb tent. After I got this my friends liked it so much two of them ended up getting the same one. Functional, reliable, well constructed, and you definitely can't beat the price. The only thing I did was to replace the stakes with sturdier ones but the ones it comes with are still pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: an h. tran

customer_reviews.title: 1/4 mile hike camping trip and it performed GREAT! It had enough room for 2 middle school ...
customer_reviews.text: I got it just in time for a 2 night, light rain, semi-cold, 1/4 mile hike camping trip and it performed GREAT! It had enough room for 2 middle school boys and all their gear with room to spare! My 12 year old son was able to set it up in less than 5 minutes and had no problems the whole weekend.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight tent
customer_reviews.text: Haven't taken this on any long distance through hikes, but was able to use it on a weekend trip in the rain. The rain fly did keep us dry for a while, but later in the night condensation started forming on our actual tent and that made for a few unwelcome cold drips in the face. Not sure how we can fix this in the future but we will have to play with it. It is extremely light and is made out of durable material. Fits my husband and I with our gear with a lot of room overhead. Overall very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: PMahoney

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent for a whitewater river kayaking trip and it was small enough to store on my inflatable kayak. It had plenty of room for me. You could fit 2 in here depending on the size of the individuals and what else you brought in the tent with you. It rained pretty hard the last day of my trip and with the rain fly it held up great and I didn't get wet at all.
customer_reviews.author: FullHouseOfCards

customer_reviews.title: Worked out well
customer_reviews.text: As you can see I took it on my trip to the four corners of the USA. Packed nice and small.
customer_reviews.author: William Holden

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, decent quality, exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: We don’t go camping often but didn’t want a super cheap tent that is shot after a couple uses. This one had good reviews and I can see why. It is easy to set up and take down, and there is room in the bag if you get the foot print as well (would have been nice if it was included, but that isn’t very common). We are looking forward to using it again on our next adventure!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Stitt

customer_reviews.title: Love this little tent!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful, light weight little tent. Sooo easy to set up! I am a 54 year old overweight female with bad knees and I set it up by myself in less than 5 minutes, and that was the very first time I did it! I expect it will only take about 3 minutes next time. It was not difficult at all. It was also easy to take down and put away. The tent is well made and a very nice quality. There are some youtube video reviews - I watched them before purchasing it and recommend you do to. They are why I went ahead and made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for 2
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for 2. Rather long than wide, so only able to stow your gear by your feet (or head if you prefer) or in the vestibules, which are of decent size. Easy set-up. My 11 year old boy-scout does it himself in less than 10 minutes, including staking the rain-fly. Has good ventilation although not fantastic. But the star here is the rain-fly. Sat though a night of pouring rain, and stayed bone-dry inside. The rainfly goes far enough down to not allow any splashing up under the fly. Really great a quality tent. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: It's The Best Bang For Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: This is the best two man tent for the money!! Isn't the most lightest for the ultra light folks,but awesome for motorcycle touring and backpacking!! If you have a friend along you can split the load. Moutainsmith quality is Great,also they have a great customer service department if you need any assistance with a warranty problem!! If your looking for a great bargain I suggest this tent.Once again Thank You Amazon for great products and Service.......
customer_reviews.author: Teardropin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good looking tent easy enough to put up and tear down. I got it for a motorcycle trip. I also bought the ground cloth. The biggest problem with camping is if the tent leaks for me camping is over, and it's off to a motel. I'm planning a longer trip and if the tent doesn't work, I can't afford the extra cost in motels. I think this will work well, and will fit in one saddlebag easily along with the rest of the camping gear leaving one bag for clothes and other gear I'll add more when I get some actual experience other than erecting it in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Tent !!
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent! Fairly lightweight compared to other tents that are free standing, have 2 doors and vestibules, and full fly. Also, doesn't have that annoying, curved, third pole that just adds weight. I had the basic tent (without pegging it down or outting the fly on) set up in less than a minute...and it only took another minute to orient the fly, and have it snapped into place. The tent corners are color coded to match the poles, so even the inexperienced can figure it out pretty quick. I just got done seam sealing it, so I havn't tested it in the woods yet. The color seems pleasing to the eye, and I look forward to taking it out.
customer_reviews.author: blackhorseveteran

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Mountainsmith tent
customer_reviews.text: We were very pleased with this tent. It performed flawlessly on our first overnight trip. It is relatively lightweight and compact. It was simple to set up, take down and repack. The price was reasonable. We are not very tall 5' 3" and 5' 7". We were able to sleep comfortably with our packs inside the tent. We have not had it out in the rain, but the rain fly gives complete coverage of the tent and the bathtub floor design looks like would be watertight. The zipper systems all worked well and were easy to operate. Nicely designed and constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Beaudoin

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent.  Plenty of Room.  Good Ventilation.  Nice Rain Fly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent as an alternative to "official" kit issued to me that was heavy, bulky and cumbersome. This tent is easy to fit in my North Face Terra 65 pack (in the wider bottom section), deploys extremely quickly, and provides protection from bugs and rain. For 1 person, it also keeps my kit stored right next to me, for enhanced security. My only wish was that it would be as functional and durable, but with a little less bulk and weight. No complaints though, as I can deploy for 4-6 days and the Mountainsmith serves me extremely well once on location.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy X3

customer_reviews.title: Beyond my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, spacious two person tent for my boyfriend and I on our hiking adventures! Gorgeous color, easy and quick to set up with color coded poles. Pretty light weight at just about 5 lbs! Love that it has two doors on each side. Inside has mesh pockets built in and an overhead hanging pocket. Really wanted a small, convenient tent that also had a mesh roof so we could star gaze - for the price I can't believe how wonderful this tent is! Haven't tried it out yet but so far so good! Will be trying it out when we summit Mt. Adams soon!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Tent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent. Lightweight and very easy to set up. I stayed dry, in more then one thunderstorm, where others tents ended up getting water inside. Only issue I had is that the tent didn't like heavy wind. Heavy winds caused the rods to snap which ripped a 4" hole into the exterior of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent! Easy to set up and take down. Roomy! I like that it has two doors so one of us can get up and go out without stepping all over the other. The two vestibules offer a nice dry area to store equipment and it's easily accessible because of the two doors. Plenty of room inside too! Two of us with inflatable mattress pads, sleeping bags, and some gear fit quite comfortably. I was hoping it would have a cargo net that hangs from the top and it did! Very handy for those items I always lose track of.
customer_reviews.author: firehound

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent for a Single Camper that likes to spread out a bit
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with this purchase. It sets up super easy and is a great size. It can be a bit snug for two people, but makes a great over-sized 1 person tent. Solid construction with lots of creature comforts built into the design. Would definitely recommend this to my outdoors friends.
customer_reviews.author: Hip Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: No 2nd thoughts
customer_reviews.text: Read a ton of reviews and made comparisons before deciding to purchase the tent. It is not the lightest for backpacking purposes but I haved used this tent multiple times and it really held up well. Temperatures range from 30's to 70 deg F. Did not have issue bout condensation and roomy for two person including gears. Love the color and versatility of the tent. Bought the ground cloth also to protect the tent but a tarp would do.
customer_reviews.author: KatoK19

customer_reviews.title: and we stayed pretty much as dry as a bone
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is a very solid tent. Rained most of the weekend, and we stayed pretty much as dry as a bone. A little condensation, but nothing that would disturb you or ruin gear. A little tight for two people, but we got by okay. If you're carrying gear with you and expect to fit two people in as well, you may want to go a size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Mund

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this tent. I bought it for when I am not using my hammock. I used it for a backpacking trip in Arizona. Hiked about 6 miles with it in my pack. Set up easily. Material is very durable and I liked how the tent poles go together. Came down easily and rolled/folded back up to the same size it originally was which I usually never find possible. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Maasen

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking tent on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Tent is simple to set-up due to the color coded snaps and poles--essentially foolproof. I have used this tent while in the Midwest, Utah and Arizona. So far no rips or leaks. Tent performs well in gusty winds and rain. The trail weight is acceptable considering the price of the tent. Not overly heavy. Great tent for the money.
customer_reviews.author: jcmiller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Let me say up front I am not an experienced camper I have never purchased a tent. Now that I have this tent I will use it often! Super easy to set up even if you are a first time camper. This tent survived a wind storm with 25 mph winds. Most of the other tents set up near mine fell apart. Great for one person w/ twin sized air mattress. Had plenty of room for boots and other small items in the tent. The coldest night of my trip was 28 degrees. The tent stayed relatively warm for the outside temps being so low. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: 12345t

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I love this tent
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this tent. It's big enough for the two of us, who are both between 55 and 6 feet. It can also fit a carry-on suitcase or duffel at one end. The zippers and seals all work great and the tent is quality. We've only camped with it in the summer and fall in Washington state , so I can't comment on how it does in snow.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tent! This is the second I have owned after giving my last one to a friend. I love the thicker material on the base most of the time I don't even need a ground sheet. It's super easy to put up, usually takes less than 5 minutes even in the dark. Has really handy vestibules inside to stash gear. Have only had a chance to test in very light rain but held up well in some really high wind. Would definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: So its a 2 person tent but its great for one person
customer_reviews.text: So its a 2 person tent but its great for one person, I'm 5'9 so it would be hard to have a 2nd person in there if I needed but as a one person tent it worked well. Not leaking though I didn't have it out in pouring ran at any point. I liked it for the several camping nights I've used it so far and look forward to using it again .
customer_reviews.author: Liz s

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Outstanding quality a reasonable cost. Nice and light. Easy to put up. Love this tent. I take this for backpacking with my wife and daughter, but it is light enough for a solo trip. This is my second Mountainsmith product and I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Fast Eddie

customer_reviews.title: and I love it. It's a little on the heavy side ...
customer_reviews.text: In the past year, my tent has seen 100 miles on the AT and numerous trips around Michigan, and I love it. It's a little on the heavy side for backpacking, but has so much space, is easy to put up, has held up to wind and rain.It's a good bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome small tent for the money. This tent has already traveled to 8 national parks since December. Went to REI and something comparable was double the price. Not as light as some tents out there, but it really is a nice tent. Also, the zippers are well made and are effective at keeping out large (VERY large wolf spiders).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Paul

customer_reviews.title: One of the plastic fly buckles broke easily and the fabric is not good for heavy use
customer_reviews.text: This tent was somewhat hard on me but we still have a loving relationship. One of the plastic fly buckles broke easily and the fabric is not good for heavy use. The zippers are sturdy although the material attached to the zippers breaks easily. The guy-wire straps on the rain fly are brilliantly designed. The overhead gear pockets are tough to manipulate in the dark. The ground level corner pockets are great for accessibility of midnight necessities. I would recommend this tent for areas that do not sustain high winds or rocky terrain.This is a THREE SEASON TENT as advertised and will suit back-packing adventures well; river trips, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: J. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Great tent - withstands extreme rain and winds!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tent. Very lightweight - perfect for backpacking and hiking. Pretty spacious - fits two tall people comfortably. Easy to set up even if you have never pitched a tent before. The directions are on the bag too but you get the hang of it very quickly. Clever design has some neat features - mesh windows for ventilation plus a rain cover; pockets on the inside for keeping stuff handy; two vestibules, zips from the inside and outside. Also we camped out during a tropical depression and the tent stayed stable and dry. Really impressed especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Bang for buck quality tent!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tent. Water seems to creep in the zipper but other than that it would keep you dry on those rainy nights. I have used it mostly on hot and rainy even stormy weather. Kept us dry during rain, and cool during summer. I love the well ventilated design of this tent. Too bad it doesn't come with a footprint. You have to purchase it separately.
customer_reviews.author: AEODMD

customer_reviews.title: For the money this is a great tent. The color coded support rods make attaching ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great tent. The color coded support rods make attaching the rain fly a snap. The materials and craftsmanship seem of high quality, everything is super light and compact. I've spent a couple nights in the tent, woke up to rain on one morning and stayed completely dry. If you are looking for a high quality tent around the $150 price point this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Barwick

customer_reviews.title: actual weight of tent is 6.6 pounds
customer_reviews.text: they lie . list weight as 5 pounds but it weighs 6.6 pounds packed . heavy tent and bulky to take backpacking . sets up easy and good for car camping . but do not buy this if you plan on backpacking ..
customer_reviews.author: gary gates

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. Very.
customer_reviews.text: Sets up in 7 minutes. And Im no expert. The rolled up size is very small. Perfect for backpacking. The color coded poles and clips make the setup beyond easy. I bet it will be easy to do at night and that might be important to some. The bath tub is taller than all other tents I have seen. Add in all the other perks and you get one of the best tents out there. It also didn't ship from Amazon but it still arrived in the same Prime timeline.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Sipes

customer_reviews.title: they were great. Ventilation worked well in below freezing temps
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent for a hunt in northern Alaska. We were out for a week in rain and some very heavy winds. I was very impressed with how tight the rain fly stretched out and the overall quality. The tent was very roomy for the two of us. It's the first tent I've owned with side entrances, and I can't say that I will ever own another without, they were great. Ventilation worked well in below freezing temps, very minimal condensation build up.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent - for the price, you simply cannot go wrong. It's easy to set up, spacious for the weight and has some nifty features. Enjoyed the stash pockets you can attach to the inside of the roof. Only rained very lightly overnight so can't really speak for the waterproofing. Some people have mentioned the pegs seem cheap, had no problem with them even on tough soil and in any case, they're so cheap to replace. My partner and I fit in fine with reasonably large packs at the end. Thoroughly recommended for 2/3 max night hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. S. Crowther

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This tent was everything I wanted. After seeing all the reviews and comparing other tents, I'm glad that I purchased this. It's extremely fast to put up and it has enough storage area for all my hiking equipment. I must warn you that I sleep in this tent myself, so it's definitely spacious. Typically, it always seems to rain when I go out camping with this. It holds up to rain quite well.The weight of the tent is not bad at all either. I would highly recommend this tent to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up and free standing. Set up on a double bed and it was longer the bed. A true 2 person tent
customer_reviews.author: casual  reader.

customer_reviews.title: Good Tent. Im dry and warm. Maybe its a bit heavy but I guess I should be more fit.
customer_reviews.text: Dank is my favorite word I use to describe things i like very much so therefore, this tent is dank. But this tent is anything but dank in the literal sense. Very airy and dries well. It kept rain out during heavy rain :) It could realistically fit 2 people and packs but if you leave your packs outside it could fit 3 or 4 people.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Hayduk

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! I have used this tent in two torrential ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I have used this tent in two torrential downpour situations and have walked away dry, fearless, and unscathed! (and the subject of envy from my fellow travelers!). I'm excited to go further with this tent and hope it continues to keep me dry. I also chose this tent because it has two zip doors, lots of windows while also providing privacy, and chill colors.
customer_reviews.author: Alana Y

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: We have used this tent on the Appalachian trail in wind and rain. I love it! There is enough room under the flap for my backpack and poles and inside is great for two adults and some gear. There are loops to hang your glasses and pockets for your wallet. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia F. Burns

customer_reviews.title: great for 1 person and air mattress, 2 would have to be close quarters.
customer_reviews.text: Love the air flow, no wet walls in the morning, even in full Sun, I disinfect too hot. Only down side is one of the doors is very tight to close, and concerns me as to how long it will last, love the pockets since purchasing it, I've spent 2 week long trips In it, and have been comfy.. I wouldn't recommend it below 25°, but up to that, I'm very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend if you are not going on a long backpacking ...
customer_reviews.text: a bit heavy for backpacking, but it is spacious and has a multitude of pockets for storage. I highly recommend if you are not going on a long backpacking trip! great for one person. may be tight for two.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect so far
customer_reviews.text: So far we've only used it twice. First time to Big Bend national park, where it was very hot, and also chilly at night up on the mountain. It did very well with the crazy wind we got up there, we didn't freeze and it stayed put. Second time we took it to Yellowstone, first night we set it up while it was starting to rain. It poured all night, and it stayed perfectly dry inside. We got rain a few times on that trip and it was never a problem. It is easy to set up, easy to take down, light, keeps us dry. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I researched tents for months trying o decide what I would need. I ended up choosing this one, as I found it to be a good balance for what I need backpacking but not breaking the bank. I'm still new to backpacking so I'm trying to find the best value for all my gear. This tent sets-up easily, has plenty of room for two people, and is lightweight to take on the trail. I was a little disappointed that it didn't pack down smaller, but given what I paid for it, and that it is light, I can manage the bulk of it. I also probably need to perfect my tent folding/packing skills. Overall, I'm super happy with this tent.
customer_reviews.author: MacKenzie Heap

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome tent. I've only used it once so far, but it lived up to all my expectations after reading the other reviews. Very spacious for a 2 person (I am 5'9" and my boyfriend is 6'). We had plenty of room for our backpacking gear in the vestibules. And there was extra space inside after both our sleeping bags were rolled out. It was very warm when we used it, and the vents came in handy. The gear loft and other pockets were super nice to have since we could hang our lights and things in easy reach spots. I highly recommend for anyone who wants a spacious, lightweight tent for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Brown

customer_reviews.title: I have used it for a year for motorcycle camping now.  Five stars
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for a year for motorcycle camping now. Good quality packs small and it is lightweight. Five stars
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: great affordable tent
customer_reviews.text: 31 days/night on the PCT held up great. Roomy for two 5'4" people. Backpacks, sleeping bags, sleeping pads all fit easily. The rain fly provided vestibules on either side for dirty shoes,hiking poles to stay safely out of the rain. There was issues with condensation but everyone using a rain fly on the trail seem to have the same issues.The free standing design was great we could put up the tent almost anywhere their was small clearing. No rips or tears. A small snag on netting. such an affordable tent. I cant wait for the next 500 miles.
customer_reviews.author: ASEA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, and light weight! Great value. I have used it in the summer in the desert as well as in Acadia (Maine) over thanksgiving. It worked in both conditions and i am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Williams

customer_reviews.title: Survived tornado winds and torrential downpour.
customer_reviews.text: The first night in use this tent survived tornado winds and torrential downpouring of rain. Not only did it hold in place but the inside of the tent stayed bone dry through the entire storm. Overall great product and will recommend to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: It's a tent, it does the job of a tent very nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I had to ordered this somewhere else as my package was delivered on a holiday weekend despite i said not too and therefore my package wound up not being there (go figure). Got this at a local store for more money of course but really love this tent. Its light enough to use for my backpacking/camping needs. Its a very easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: The ventilation is great and no condensation
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3 season tent and I can't compare to other brands. I used this tent to the Shenandoah national park in Virginia up high in the mountains. It rain all day and night Friday and Saturday, and it did not get wet. The ventilation is great and no condensation. On Sunday the hurricane Mathew was in North Carolina and it withstand the heavy winds, I mean Heavy winds up in the mountains. I will recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: evette

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tent
customer_reviews.text: Very useful and functional tent that I have used on a few occasions as a bicycle tent. Is waterproof. Fits very conveniently on the rear rack. Adequate space for one person and luggage. Have not tried with two people and do not intend to do so. The double wall design is useful and provides some insulation on cooler weather. Recommend purchasing this with the footprint sold by Mountainsmith Morrison.
customer_reviews.author: SardoolS1

customer_reviews.title: 5lbs 11oz
customer_reviews.text: I like the tent, its sturdy and easy to set up but the given weight for it on here was 4 lbs 11 oz but its actually 5lbs 11 oz which came as quite a disappointment for me. I wanted to mainly use it for hiking so that extra weight makes a big difference to me. Had I known the real weight, I would have gotten something else
customer_reviews.author: Jared Wallace

customer_reviews.title: well designed and quick!
customer_reviews.text: Pops up in literally a minute. My brother asks to borrow it all the time. He has his tent up in a jiffy, when others are still working theirs. Very helpful when the weather is turning bad quickly. Well designed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The tent is heavier to carry than I would like (not good for ultra light tramping) but other than the weight, everything works great. Shields against cold, keeps out bugs, great moisture control, spacious for 2, nice hanging shelf with corner pockets, sturdy, and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: The tent was easy to set up & take down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a camping / backpacking trip in Utah and Arizona. The tent was easy to set up & take down, protected us from various weather conditions (including rain), and held up nicely. It was the largest thing in our packs, but definitely didn't tip the scale or take up too much space. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, many friends have purchased since seeing it
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, many friends have purchased since seeing it, easy to set up. Also - my picture is the forth picture shown! Lit up against the black back drop and stars - it has handled Utah to the Rockies without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Rion Smith

customer_reviews.title: ... used this tent a couple times now and I'm pleased with its performance
customer_reviews.text: I've used this tent a couple times now and I'm pleased with its performance. Easy to set up, stayed dry during a gentle rain, and generous room for one person. Would probably be a little tight for two, but of course that depends on the size of the people.
customer_reviews.author: MUTiger

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Great backpacking tent. VERY easy to set up. The screen on it is big for breezy nights. It's perfect size for two people.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbabwe

customer_reviews.title: Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Spent 5 nights in Yosemite and stayed dry and warm from the wind. Def would reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Great motocycle tent
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy to backpack, but a VERY well built tent that has kept me dry and warm during three very wet and cool nights out. Love the dual exit doors, though I only use the tent solo. Great bathtub but I purchased the footprint as well. VERY happy with this purchase right now - Will update in a year.
customer_reviews.author: lone wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great tent cant wait to keep using.
customer_reviews.text: Tent is awesome. Used it in cold and wet camping trips and it kept us perfectly dry and very warm inside the tent. Surprised at how well it holds in body heat to keep you warm. Pretty good amount of room for 2 people if you dont mind being close. Im 6 foot and its long enough also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mountainsmith Morrison 2 Person Tent
product_meta.description: DECENT FEATURES of the Mountainsmith Morrison 2 Person Tent Three Season flexibility Two Door / Two Vestibule layout Free-standing four corner tent Bathtub floor construction Taped floor seams Mesh wall panels Detachable ceiling loft pocket Interior mesh storage pockets Clip-pole attachment for lighter weight and better breathability Guyout attachment points Reflective guylines Tent fly ventilation windows Color-coded buckle attachment of Tent and Fly Grommet pole attachment Reinforced V-stakes 7000 Series Aluminum Alloy Poles (Yunan) The SPECS Capacity: 2 Persons Dimensions: 92.0" x 56.0" x 43.0" / 234 x 142 x 110 cm Packed Dimensions: 18.0" x 7.5" / 45.75 x 19 cm Packed Weight: 4 lbs 11 oz / 2.15 kg YKK Zippers Nylon Storage Sack Eight 6061 Aluminum V-Stakes Instructions printed on Stuff Sack Fabric: Fly: 185t Poly PU2000MM F/R, Tent: 185t Breathable Poly F/R, Floor: 190t Poly PU5000mm F/R

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
